message:
So if I did need to make a blocking call using .Result or .Wait(), where in my method "call stack" should I use ConfigureAwait(false)?  
- on the "await ..." line inside the method that is being called with "await ...Result"?  
- on every "await ..." line in every method in my call stack?  
- or, could I just use it on the SignalR Invoke, down at the bottom of the call stack?

Assuming it's feasible, the last one would be ideal from a maintenance point of view. All our SignalR Invokes live in a "facade layer", and it would be easier to apply ConfigureAwait() as a matter of course in here, rather than rely on a developer remembering to apply it where required.
